definition: to betroth a girl (in arranged marriages)
to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate

sentences.english: Her parents betrothed her to the boy of the neighboring village.
sentences.chinese: 她父母在她年幼时就把她许配给邻村的一个小男孩。

sentences.english: The lady assured to him her daughter.
The old rascal has promised his daughter to a cousin of the Seixas.
sentences.chinese: 那个老混蛋，把女儿许配给了赛克萨斯家的一个表亲。

sentences.english: He betrothed his daughter to a rich man.
sentences.chinese: 他把他的女儿许配给一个有钱人。

sentences.english: With these words, the king gave the princess to the leap frog.
sentences.chinese: 国王因为这一点，将女儿许配给了跳蛙。

sentences.english: But the landlord had already accepted the proposal of the young master surnamed Ma, a son of a rich family.
sentences.chinese: 可祝员外早已把女儿许配给了有钱人家的少爷马公子。

sentences.english: She was engaged to a rich businessman by her parents.
sentences.chinese: 她的父母把她许配给了一位富商。

sentences.english: She has been promised to Bill.
I formally marry my daughter to you.
sentences.chinese: 那我就正式将我的女儿许配给你。

sentences.english: They did not like the idea of giving their daughter to the lion, but they did not want to enrage 1 the king of beasts.
sentences.chinese: 他不忍将女儿许配给野兽，但又害怕激怒这兽中之王。

sentences.english: Now, I let him marry you.
The thing for me to have done was to have married her to him in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说所做的一件事就是首先把她许配给了他。

definition: (of a woman) to marry a man of lower social status/to marry down
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to take a wife/to get married (man)
to make a pledge to be married, without parents' approval
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
